lines.text: I thought that was rather clever of me.
Yes, I thought you thought so.
She may be his wife, but she's engaged to me!
Would I ask you to do this thing for me if I didn't consider you practically my wife?
Would you ask your wife to hook up with that ape?
The ape objects.
What'll we use for a headline?
I don't care. Anything. "War threatens Europe!"
Which country?
Flip a nickel!
I don't care who he is. Nobody talks to me like a house detective.
How do you know how a house detective talks?
Don't you think I read?

[Bill and Connie getting married by a Justice of the Peace]
My wife will be the witness. She'll be down in a minute... Oh, here she is now.

[Barely glancing at the couple]
Are they sober?
lines.character: Wife of the Justice of the Peace

lines.text: Well, I... I... I think so.
This is love, not liquor.
Gladys, do you want me to kill myself?
Did you change your insurance?
Well I hope you'll be very happy and don't forget to invite me to your silver anniversary.
It'll have to be in the next six weeks!
That man is a first class angler!
If he's first class, I'm traveling steerage.
Driver, can't you go any faster?
I can lady, but the cab can't.
The things I do for that newspaper!
Where did you go when you left us Bill?
Intelligence Department Warren, I always did like contrast. Well, Cheerio!

[introducing]
Mr. Bane, my future wife.
Nonsense! I'll be in my office. Get rid of this woman!
Any woman can be starved by neglect. The little attentions Bill paid you seemed so much greater, because you weren't getting them from Haggerty.
The only time Warren ever sent me flowers, he signed Bill's name to the card!
Exactly! He probably never noticed the clothes you wore, never told you how lovely you looked, the way Bill did.
That's right! How did you know?
Women can't fool women about men.
You can't build a life on hate, or a marriage on spite. Marriage is too important. Mine only lasted an hour, but... I know.
